item.title: Roadworks diversion encouraging misuse of private road, 30th January
item.description:
I live in 1C Chelsfield Road, Orpington, BR5 4DN. I've had a car drive through our private road in front of my house to avoid road works in the area. I was walking out through the residents' car exit & found this car in front of me that was clearly heading inside the private road, I pointed towards the signs that say 'no entrance allowed' & that it's a private road for residents only, but the driver ignored me & speeded past me! I was shocked & feared for my life but tried to take a picture of the car's license number, which I have sent as well. This is a recurring event, for cars to use our private road instead of the public road as it's wider & has no road works so cars tend to reroute to the private road in case of road works or high traffic. This makes me feel unsafe in front of my own home & it's clear trespassing that needs to be actioned by authorities. Our developer applied for a gate but it was rejected as it doesn't meet planning requirements apparently. Can you please help us prevent this trespassing & make us feel safe? As you can see, mere signs are not helpful, drivers are blank out ignoring residents' wishes even when they're right in front of them!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 269, High Street, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very long puddle that forms after rain. The drain isn’t working properly., 30th January
item.description:
A massive puddle forms on Queens Mead Road after rain. It is very deep comes up onto the pavement and covers some of the grass verge. The grass area has collapsed. There is a huge pot hole in the pavement also. The drain doesn’t work effectively and is often just full to the brim and the once rain comes it just floods. Cars and vans passing often can’t avoid it, the spray is very high and sprays filthy water all over people. Pedestrians have to be very careful not to get drenched by it. This issue has been present for years and never gets resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
